list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Some department stores have a cafeteria.

list_ex_of_english: The index case was the cook employed in the hospital cafeteria.
Alcoholic hand rub was made available in common toilets, treatment rooms and at the cafeteria.
In addition, there was a toilet for the food handlers next to the cafeteria kitchen which did not have a separate washbasin.
Of the 40 cases, three were food handlers working in the cafeteria, 34 were hospital staff (of whom 50 % were medical staff) and three were relatives.
Following this, a constant level of cafeteria noise was digitally mixed with the stimuli.
Moving objects are easily programmed - we have doors that open on proximity, functional elevators, drinks machines in the cafeteria and the odd computer.
These measures included a requirement that employers provide housing, cafeterias, shops, and nurseries for the use of their workers.
All the subjects affected had consumed some foodstuffs in the hospital cafeteria.
